title: Report Published Deodorants in Slovakia
text:
(MENAFN Press) Deodorants remained in the slow positive sales growth which was seen during the whole review period. An increase of 2% in value was recorded during 2014. New product developments such as deodorants with added benefits or deodorants made with natural components had a strong impact on the sales increase of the category. However classic deodorant sprays enjoyed the biggest popularity thanks to affordable prices which was an essential factor for Slovak consumers in 2014.
Competitive Landscape
Unilever Slovensko was the clear leader of deodorants during the whole review period accounting for a value share of 24% in 2014. The company offered two popular brands Axe for men and Rexona for women which were frequent choices of Slovaks due to their strong promotion on television which attracted their attention and wide choice of different scents. However Unilever saw a one-percentage-point value share loss as the competition strengthened within the category.
Industry Prospects
Deodorants is not expected to witness a significant change in value sales performance over the forecast period and is expected to record grow tha ta value CAGR of 2% at constant 2014 prices. Slovak consumers are expected to be more interested in innovative products as their purchasing power will increase. Manufacturers will be highly motivated to bring new product launches on the market.
